item.title: Microsoft Is Launching Its Own Mobile Game Store
item.description:
Highlights

  • Microsoft is gearing up to challenge Apple and Google in the mobile gaming market this summer with its own Xbox mobile store.
  • The Xbox mobile store will initially focus on first-party Xbox games and plans to expand to include outside publishers in the future.
  • With a web-based accessibility strategy, Xbox aims to create a seamless experience across all devices and countries, independent of closed ecosystem stores.

Microsoft is officially entering the mobile gaming store scene this summer. With the acquisition of Activision-Blizzard-King formalized, the legal precedent of Epic vs. Apple settled, and the European Union disrupting the digital market, Microsoft and Xbox believe the time is right to vie for a piece of the market.

The current mobile gaming store ecosystem is primarily dominated by Apple's App Store, Google Play, and their respective fees and terms, so there's not a ton of options when it comes to where consumers purchase mobile games. Some may recall Epic Games' 2021 anti-monopoly lawsuit against Apple, which concluded in early 2024 without making too much headway against this alleged monopoly. But now Microsoft is entering the fray with a new strategy.

Related
All the Studios Microsoft Has Acquired So Far
Microsoft has developed a reputation for its high-profile studio acquisitions, with the tech giant amassing an impressive roster over the years.

Sarah Bond, President of Xbox, announced at the Bloomberg Tech Summit that Xbox's mobile gaming store will arrive in July of this year. Bond explained that what will make Xbox's mobile store unique is its initial accessibility "on the web," as opposed to Apple or Google's app-based mobile stores . The store will initially feature deals on in-game items for first-party Xbox games and will eventually open the selection to outside publishers. Bond went on to further explain that the decision to start with a web-based store "allows [Xbox] to have it be an experience that's accessible across all devices, all countries, no matter what, independent of the policies of closed ecosystem stores."

Bond specifically mentioned Microsoft's controversial acquisition of Activision-Blizzard-King , finalized in October 2023, as one of the reasons for the move to mobile. With this purchase, games like Candy Crush Saga , Call of Duty Mobile , and Hearthstone all fall under Microsoft's first-party portfolio. And it's these games, along with the powerhouse title Minecraft , that Microsoft intends to put in the new Xbox store first but hopes to get other publishers in the store as soon as it can. "We want to make sure that we start and we scale with our own IP first," Bond explained. "That allows us to make sure that the experience we bring partners into really builds on all the quality and experience we have as a team."

Bond seemed to imply that despite the store being web-based initially, it would eventually be accessible through other platforms, saying that once the experience is stable across all devices and countries, it will "extend from there." Bond did not elaborate on what this extension would entail, nor what it would mean for the future of the current Microsoft Store .

An Xbox Mobile Store Has Been in the Works for a While

Xbox CEO Phil Spencer, in an interview with the Financial Times last year, specifically mentioned the idea of creating an Xbox mobile market, citing the European Union's Digital Markets Act . The act, which largely came into force in May 2023, aims to make the European digital market fairer by identifying "gatekeepers," i.e., the largest companies operating in the mobile industry. Sarah Bond's reference to the purchase of ABK seems to affirm the motive for purchasing the conglomeration, and as the EU begins to make progress on the Digital Markets Act, it would appear that the conditions are aligning for Microsoft and Xbox to make their own push into creating a rival for Apple and Google. Time will tell what the arrival of the Xbox Mobile Store will mean for the Microsoft Store at large, as neither Microsoft nor Xbox have released any further details.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leak Shows Jade's Complete Kit
item.description:
Highlights

  • HoYoverse expanded the playable roster in Honkai: Star Rail with new characters like Jade and Robin in the Version 2.2 update.
  • A leak has revealed Jade's complete kit, showcasing her offensive skills like Acquisition Surety and Vow of the Deep in battle.
  • Jade, a senior manager in the IPC, works with characters Topaz and Aventurine, with updates scheduled for Version 2.3.

A new Honkai: Star Rail leak has revealed the complete kit for the upcoming five-star character Jade. HoYoverse keeps expanding the game's playable roster with each new update, introducing at least two new characters. The ongoing Version 2.2 has already introduced a new five-star character named Robin, who is part of the first banner phase.

Honkai: Star Rail 's second banner phase for Version 2.2 will introduce the long-awaited five-star DPS unit Boothill. Even though Robin arrived just a couple of days ago, recent leaks have already revealed tons of information about the two new characters that will join the roster in the next update.

Related
Honkai: Star Rail Leaks Firefly's Complete Kit
A new Honkai: Star Rail leak reveals the complete kit for the upcoming Destruction five-star character Firefly, who is scheduled to arrive in 4.6.

Honkai: Star Rail has already confirmed the arrival of Firefly and Jade in the upcoming update 2.3. There is not a lot of official information about the mysterious character, Jade. So far, the official storyline confirmed that Jade is the senior manager in the IPC Strategic Investment Department. She is also a member of the Ten Stonehearts, a group of high-ranking executives in the IPC who work under the leadership of Diamond. Honkai 's story also confirmed that she works regularly with two familiar characters, Topaz and Aventurine, both of whom are part of the playable roster and members of the Ten Stonehearts. A new post on the popular Honkai: Star Rail Leaks subreddit has given more information about Jade's power on the field.

Honkai: Star Rail Jade's Kit Explained

  • Skill: Acquisition Surety - Applies an effect called Debt Collector to a party member in Honkai: Star Rail and increases their Speed by 30 for 3 turns. After a Debt Collector attacks, he deals additional Quantum damage equal to 20% of Jade's ATK to each enemy target hit. The effect also consumes 5% of the Debt Collector's max HP
  • Ultimate: Vow of the Deep - Jade deals Quantum damage equal to 240% of the ATK to all enemies on the field. The effect also enhances the follow-up attack from Jade's Talent by 80%.

Like most Erudition characters in Honkai: Star Rail , Jade has an offensive Talent effect. Jade's Talent, Fang of Flare Flaying, makes her gain stacks each time she or a Debt Collector attacks an enemy. Once eight stacks have been reached, Jade launches a powerful follow-up attack.

Jade's Technique effect inflicts enemies within a set area with Blind Fealty for 10 seconds, which prevents them from actively attacking allies. The effect also deals Quantum damage equal to 50% of Jade's Attack to all enemies. These leaks should be taken with a grain of salt, considering that HoYoverse could still make changes before Honkai: Star Rail Version 2.3 arrives on the live servers.

item.title: Netflix and Roblox Teaming Up for New Digital Theme Park
item.description:
Highlights

  • Netflix and Roblox have partnered to create a digital amusement park experience, Netflix Nextworld, featuring popular TV shows like Stranger Things and Cobra Kai.
  • Fans can explore worlds like Hawkins High and East Blue Brawls, participate in mini-games, collect items, and attend social events within Nextworld.
  • By completing quests and collecting currency, players can unlock exclusive items and decor for their Fan Pod, as well as participate in upcoming events like Jurassic World: Chaos Theory.

Roblox and Netflix have announced that the two companies are collaborating on a new digital amusement park experience called Netflix Nextworld . Roblox and Netflix have teamed up multiple times in the past, with the streaming platform having created its own group and world to promote various shows. Some of the shows Netflix has promoted include the likes of Sonic Prime , Stranger Things , and more through special events.

These special events usually gave fans an experience in Roblox that replicated the world of the show that was being promoted. For example, the Stranger Things: Starcourt Mall Roblox event gave fans the chance to explore Stranger Things ' iconic Starcourt Mall , along with giving players quests that could be completed to obtain Star Coins, allowing items to be purchased through the in-game shop. While the event was shut down sometime last year, it appears Netflix is replicating that feeling by giving fans access to a bunch of worlds inspired by the streaming platform's lineup of available TV shows via Netflix Nextworld .

Related
Tekken 8 Producer Impressed with Waffle House Stage in Roblox
Tekken 8's producer is impressed with a recreation of the fighting game within Roblox, complete with the highly requested Waffle House stage.

Netflix Nextworld is a digital theme park in Roblox that allows fans to explore the worlds of their favorite shows. Some of the shows currently represented in Netflix Nextworld include Stranger Things , Cobra Kai , the live-action One Piece series , and Rebel Moon , among others. All of these 3D interactive spaces are available for fans to explore now through an Early Access launch.

Netflix Nextworld has three worlds available in this launch period, which can all be accessed through a hub world. These experiences are Stranger Things: Escape from Hawkins High , One Piece: East Blue Brawls , and Rebel Moon: Outskirts Battle . These worlds are guarded by various characters from the shows, with players being able to meet Dustin, Monkey D. Luffy , and Jimmy in this game.

Shows Currently Represented in Netflix Nextworld

  • Cobra Kai
  • One Piece (2023)
  • Rebel Moon
  • Stranger Things
  • Friends

Players can also participate in a gaming side quest in this new Roblox experience by playing various mini-games. These include a guessing game called Is It Cake, to a karate-themed balancing board game based on Cobra Kai . As players explore these different worlds, they can collect objects and wearables from different shows and movies to decorate themselves or their "Fan Pod," which acts as a home base that can be kept private for the player or be opened for friends to visit.

As players get more currency in Nextworld , they can get more exclusive items, such as free limited User-Generated Content like a One Piece -themed flag. Other social events and premieres will take place in Nextworld as well, such as a limited-time Jurassic World: Chaos Theory event that will take place on May 17.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Gives Charcadet Four Impressive New Evolutions
item.description:
Highlights

  • Creative Pokemon fan designs new evolutions for Charcadet, offering unique concepts and abilities for each form.
  • Charcadet's potential evolutions include Fire/Bug, Fire/Ground, Fire/Dragon, and Fire/Fighting types, each with their own evolution criteria.
  • Artist OnduRegion's detailed artwork and lore for Charcadet's evolutions captivates Pokemon fans, generating excitement for Pokemon Legends: Z-A.

A talented Pokemon fan has made four new evolutions for Charcadet, sharing the designs online. With the release of Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , Pokemon fans saw the return of many Pokemon from other generations. Meanwhile, the Gen 9 games introduced 103 new critters with different abilities and stories to expand the already immense Pokemon universe.

One of these newcomers is Charcadet, a Fire-type Pokemon said to have been born from burning coal. To evolve Charcadet , Pokemon fans take two routes, one using Auspicious Armor to turn it into Armarouge, or Malicious Armor to evolve it into Ceruledge, two of the best Gen 9 Pokemon. Outside the games, Charcadet only has a quick appearance in Pokemon: Paldean Winds , while Ceruledge had more screen time when it appeared as Amethio's Pokemon, one of the antagonists of Pokemon: Horizons . Charcadet is a small Pokemon that draws attention for its knight-like appearance, and to show the potential that the Pokemon could achieve, a fan designed new forms for it.

Related
Pokemon Fan Shows What Charcadet Line Would Look Like in Paper Mario Style
One creative Pokemon fan artist designs a family of some of the Paldea region's most famous Pokemon in a classic Paper Mario art style.

Twitter user OnduRegion created four new forms for Charcadet, suggesting what it would be like if it could evolve into a new creature in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . Aracniddle has huge tweezers coming out of its body, resulting in a creature that would have a big chance of becoming one of the coolest bug Pokemon . One of Drillava's hands is a drill, and details in the design may remind Pokemon fans of Golurk. Hydralgon's fists live up to the Pokemon's name and have two dragon heads, while Brawlord has imposing fists that levitate around it.

Pokemon Fan Art Gives Charcadet Four New Evolutions with Different Concepts

Making their artwork even more appealing, the artist shared additional information about the four Pokemon, such as abilities, Pokedex entries, and the evolution criteria for each form. Charcadet evolves into the Fire/Bug-type Aracniddle when it receives the Parasite Armor item and transforms into the Fire/Ground-type Drillava when it gets the Golem Armor. Charcadet's evolution into the Fire/Dragon-type Hydralgon happens when the Pokemon gains the Scale Armor. Receiving a fang from the adorable baby Pokemon Riolu , Charcadet evolves into the Fire/Fighting-type Brawlord.

That isn't the first time OnduRegion has created an impressive evolution for a Pokemon, having previously given Hawlucha a wrestling-inspired design , earning praise from the community by sharing their work. In Charcadet's fan art, the artist stands out with the intriguing lore and the bolder designs. With Pokemon Legends: Z-A hitting the shelves next year, fans will have to wait to find out which Pokemon will get a new evolution, and whether Charcadet will be one of them.

item.title: Microsoft Rewards Adds Helpful New Feature
item.description:
Highlights

  • Microsoft Rewards offers points for using Microsoft products daily, with new Streak Protection feature for uninterrupted streaks.
  • Users can earn points for tasks like searching with Bing, playing Xbox games, and make donations or purchases with points.
  • Streak Protection allows users to miss up to 14 days without losing their streak, but must remember to turn it off to avoid using multiple protections.

Microsoft has rolled out an update to its Microsoft Rewards program that looks to help users earn more Microsoft points. While it began hitting Rewards dashboards back in March, more Microsoft Rewards users should see the new support measure showing up for them.

Microsoft Rewards encourages users to use Microsoft products by doling out points for things they do online on a near-daily basis, like searching with Bing or Edge, playing games on Xbox systems or the Xbox app, and purchasing things from the Microsoft store. These points can be used to enter sweepstakes for Microsoft products , purchase Microsoft gift cards, or even make a monetary donation to a nonprofit organization. Rewards users also receive a daily list of personalized actions on their Rewards dashboard that they can complete to earn bonus points. By completing their daily activities, users build up a streak that earns them more points the longer they can keep it going, but missing one day resets the streak and the bonus points entirely.

Related
How PlayStation Stars Compares to Microsoft Rewards
Although Sony's PlayStation Stars loyalty program is similar to Microsoft Rewards, there are several differences that help it stand out.

But, as it happens, sometimes life gets in the way of a good streak. Back in March, the official Microsoft Bing Developer account quietly announced in a tweet that Microsoft would begin adding a Streak Protection feature to the Microsoft Rewards dashboard. Users can activate the feature if they don't think they're going to get to their activities that day for up to 14 missed days per year.

Rolling Out Microsoft Rewards Streak Protection

When this was announced back in March, it was still being rolled out to a fairly small group of users. Since then, users like Video Game Tracker's Alan Feely have reported the feature becoming available to more Rewards accounts. User reception to Streak Protection has been somewhat mixed, with most expressing relief that they'll be able to keep their streak even if they happen to go on vacation and can't get to their activities on a particular day.

Anyone who's ever lost a Duolingo streak understands the emotional devastation that comes with breaking a streak. On paper, it seems like a great way to keep users interested and invested in the Microsoft Rewards program.

Other users have been pointing out what is either a glitch or design oversight: When a user activates Streak Protection for a particular day, they must remember to turn it off the following day, or they'll burn another Streak Protection. Some users have reported that they've turned it on and left it on just in case something comes up. A week and a half later, they'll receive a notification saying that they're almost out of Streak Protection days even if they've been completing their allotted daily activities every day since. So, while Microsoft 's new feature seems to be a major relief for those who can't get to their Microsoft Rewards dashboards every day , there do seem to be some drawbacks that may prevent users from reaching the elusive 999-day Rewards Streak badge.
